Subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (4/6). Sudden floods, rising sea levels, devastating droughts, wildfires… Climate disasters have combined on this island of five million people. Its residents want to believe they will adapt.

Rio de Janeiro: Claudio Castro, the governor behind the deadliest police raid in the state's history
Subhead: The police operation that reportedly left 120 people dead in the favelas of Rio on Tuesday was ordered by the 46-year-old conservative governor, who oversees one of the most lethal police forces in the country.

Title: In Canada, Marineland threatens to euthanize its beluga whales
Subhead: Closed to the public for a year and heavily in debt, the aquatic park has unsuccessfully requested emergency funding from the federal government to continue caring for its 30 remaining beluga whales.

Title: Over 1,000 items looted in California museum heist
Subhead: Stolen items include neckpieces by the late artist and metalsmith Florence Resnikoff, a pair of scrimshaw walrus tusks and Native American baskets. The burglary occurred in the early morning hours of October 15 at an off-site storage facility of the Oakland Museum of California, Oakland Police said.

Title: 'Airbnb has shaped the idea that everything can be monetized. It's a logic of constant optimization'
Subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (2/6). In Paris, about one-third of the listings available on Airbnb have been removed from the 'permanent' housing market, which contributes to the housing crisis in the French capital, explains researcher Jeanne Richon in an interview with Le Monde.

How Airbnb made France its favorite destination, with more than one million listings
Subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (1/6). In 15 years, the platform has established itself in France, the leading tourist destination, thanks to effective lobbying and favorable tax conditions. It has even worsened the housing crisis. The company is now expanding its offerings to continue its growth.

Title: Romania's new 'National Cathedral,' the largest in the Orthodox world, sparks controversy
Subhead: After 15 years of construction, the People's Salvation Cathedral in Bucharest opened its doors to the public on Sunday. A source of pride for many Romanians, it has also drawn criticism for its cost, which was largely funded by public money.

Title: Madagascar's new government faces scrutiny from Gen Z
Subhead: President Michaël Randrianirina announced the 28 members of the government on Tuesday, October 28. Opposition leaders to the ousted regime, newcomers and technocrats now have 60 days to deliver results.
